title: Green Plan 2030
summary: Comprehensive overview of Singapore's Green Plan 2030, a whole-of-nation movement launched in February 2021 to advance sustainable development and meet UN 2030 Sustainable Development Agenda and Paris Agreement commitments.
description: Whole-of-nation movement to advance sustainable development agenda
leading_ministries: Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment (MSE)

climate_targets.2030_emissions_target: Around 60 million tonnes of CO2 equivalent after peaking emissions earlier

five_key_pillars.name: City in Nature
five_key_pillars.goal: Create a green, liveable and sustainable home for Singaporeans

five_key_pillars.name: Sustainable Living
five_key_pillars.goal: Reduce carbon emissions, keep the environment clean, and make saving resources and energy a way of life

five_key_pillars.name: Energy Reset
five_key_pillars.goal: Use cleaner energy and increase energy efficiency to lower Singapore carbon footprint

five_key_pillars.name: Green Economy
five_key_pillars.goal: Seek green growth to create new jobs, transform industries and harness sustainability as competitive advantage

five_key_pillars.name: Resilient Future
five_key_pillars.goal: Build up Singapore's climate resilience and enhance food security

key_initiatives: Cleaner-energy cars with 60,000 EV charging points by 2030 (up from 28,000)
20% of schools to be carbon-neutral by 2030
Two-thirds reduction of net carbon emissions from schools by 2030
Eco Stewardship Programme for youth sustainability education
GreenGov.SG initiative for public sector leadership
30% reduction in waste sent to landfill (20% by 2026)
greengovsg_target: Public-sector emissions to peak around 2025 (5 years ahead of national 2030 target)

public_engagement.idea_submission: Form available for Green Plan ideas
public_engagement.sectors: Public, Private and People sectors co-creation
public_engagement.resources: Infographics and reports available for download

achievements_2021: Documented in infographs covering emissions, energy, transport, buildings, and waste
data_source_note: Summary compiled from official SG Green Plan website
